subject: RE: [junit] how can i test JSP with JUnit?
msgSnippet: Check Cactus http://enhydra.objectweb.org/doc/5.1/Tools/Cactus/howto_jsp.html Indira ... From: Erik Husby [mailto:mhusby@mac.com] Sent: Thursday, November 04,
messageBody:
Check Cactus

http://enhydra.objectweb.org/doc/5.1/Tools/Cactus/howto_jsp.html

Indira

-----Original Message-----
From: Erik Husby [mailto:mhusby@...]
Sent: Thursday, November 04, 2004 12:38 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] how can i test JSP with JUnit?



>
>
> it is quite straight to test java classes with JUnit by writing
> input data to methods and asserting output. but how can i generate
> input data to JSP and then check validation of output from web
> server?
>
>


Check out jWebUnit -- http://jwebunit.sourceforge.net/ -- (and
indirectly HttpUnit)

It allows a JUnit test to send http requests to the server and handle
their responses.

Erik Husby
